Part 2: Rectangular Hole Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0941, 0.0, 0.0656] Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the negative Z-axis by a depth of 0.2812 units to create a cut on the existing solid body, forming a rectangular hole. Part 3: Rectangular Prism Create a new coordinate system with the following parameters: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.1289, 0.75, 0.1289] Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Within the sketch, create a rectangle defined by the following edges: * Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.3046, 0.0] * Line 2: Start Point [0.3046, 0.0], End Point [0.3046, 0.3046] * Line 3: Start Point [0.3046, 0.3046], End Point [0.0, 0.3046] * Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.3046], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3046. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by a depth of 0.324 units to create a 3D rectangular prism. Cut this prism from the existing solid to form the final shape.
